group_1.textLeft: Thanks for the food!
Maan...somehow I'm in a really good mood now!

group_1.textRight: Yaay!
If you'd like to, please eat and@drink as much as you want.
I can fix up any kind of food you'd like.

group_1.textLeft: Wow, are you sure?!
But wait, you should save it@for your other customers...

group_1.textRight: Oh, that's not a problem.
At this rate, it doesn't look like we'll be seeing any...

group_1.textLeft: (Ain't that the truth...@There's not a single other customer in sight.)
Is it always like this?
Even though your cooking's this good.
Don't you think it's weird that@you haven't gotten more publicity?

group_1.textRight: No...it's because of my own shortcomings.
Valentine's Day is almost here,@and we still haven't gotten any orders.
It seems I still haven't trained myself enough...
Dad keeps saying stuff like that, but...@is it because other shops have tastier food?

group_1.textLeft: That's not it at all.@This taste has my own personal Seal of Quality.

group_1.textRight: Right...!
The customers who always come here, though...
They kept saying we aren't@'convenient' or 'familiar' enough.

group_1.textLeft: (Convenient... Familiar...)
(That's right...it's the location that's bad.@It's too far from the train station.)
(But no, it's not just that...)

group_1.textRight: When Dad was little, he went to study@abroad at a shop in a foreign country.
So he says he never had any@'connections' back home or anything.

group_1.textLeft: (...You'd need a recommendation from a famous@confectioner or something, basically?)
(I guess being able to make good food@just isn't enough anymore, huh...)

group_1.textRight: If they could just stop and try one bite of it...
Then they'd understand how tasty it really is...

group_1.textLeft: (It's just like...I was back then.)

group_1.textCenter: Why isn't anybody coming in?@The church...
Even for 5 minutes.@If they'd just lend their ears and listen...
Everyone could finally see that@there's truth in what Dad has to say...
Leave it to me, and I can make that wish come true.

group_1.textLeft: [chara:200652:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]...?!

group_1.textRight: Eh...huh?@Did that animal...just talk...?!
My name is Kyubey.
If you'll tell me what it is you wish for,@I can grant one wish for you.

group_1.textLeft: What I wish for...?

group_1.textRight: That's right. And in doing so,@you'll form a contract with me and...

group_1.textLeft: Become a Magical Girl, is that it?
Big Sis Kyoko?
Beat it, Kyubey.
This town doesn't need any more Magical Girls.
Jeez...
The Witches here are dying out as it is,@what are you even trying to do?

group_1.textRight: Kyoko, I believe I was talking to this girl here.
Sumomo, you want everyone to@try your father's cakes, right?
If you'll entrust it to me, I promise@I will make that wish come true.

group_1.textLeft: Trust it...to you...?
...Yeah, and just how'd that@turn out for my family, huh?
That wish didn't come close to making up@for the horrible mess it caused, did it?

group_1.textRight: Your wish was granted, though.@That much is true, isn't it?

group_1.textLeft: I'm only gonna say this one more time.@Beat it.
Big Sis Kyoko?!

group_1.textRight: Going the forceful route, huh?@[wait:0.5]...Good grief.
Uh...@[chara:801202:lipSynch_0][wait:0.5][chara:801202:lipSynch_1]All that just now...

group_1.textLeft: That guy's Kyubey.
He looks for girls he thinks have potential and turns@'em into Magical Girls in exchange for a wish.
But there are really harsh consequences that@come with it. He's basically a con artist.

group_1.textRight: Magical Girl...?@Exchange...?

group_1.textLeft: You remember that monster thing you saw earlier,@before you passed out?
It's a Magical Girl's responsibility to keep fighting@those things. Right up until we kick it, basically.

group_1.textRight: So that monster...wasn't a dream...?

group_1.textLeft: Yeah. Since you could see that thing...that Witch,@and Kyubey...
Seems you have the potential to be a Magical Girl.
Don't you go making any kind@of wish if you see him again!
Cause there's no way any good will come of it!

group_1.textRight: But...

group_1.textLeft: If you want someone to eat this cake,@I'll just bring some of my friends over here.

group_1.textRight: Really?!@[chara:801202:lipSynch_0][wait:1.0][chara:801202:lipSynch_1]Thank you so much, Big Sis Kyoko!

group_1.textLeft: Yep, leave it to me!
(...Seems like I always end up gettin' soft on kids@that're around my little sister's age...)

group_1.narration: That kid who became a Magical Girl@because of me...
I just don't want the same thing to happen again...
